comment: Dr. Daniell is the best teacher I have had at KSU. You will learn alot, I came out of this class understanding how to write and feeling confident that I could do something I never had before.

This woman is too old to be teaching. I had no idea what her anecdotes had to do with class. She is confused about what to do and will grade you in line with how much she likes you, although she will deny it. Save yourself the hardship, take a different teacher.

Dr. Daniell's super power is that she makes her students want to work hard. She clearly knows a lot about rhet/comp and wants students to explore the subjects they're interested in and develop fruitful research projects. She won't tell you exactly what to do on a paper, but she'll guide you through the writing process and answer all your questions.
Dr. Daniell is REALLY unclear about assignments and makes the assignments a hundred times more difficult than they need to be. She doesn't like students asking questions to her after class.

Dr. Daniell really wants you to do well! Makes it easy to plan out final project, and response papers are well spaced out.  Come to class and particiapte, you should have no problem getting an A. Would def take her again!
I think besides that for me she is hot, she is a Excellent teacher. I learn a lot in her class, and I am so glad I took it with her.

Firm but not overly mean most of the time. Very organized. Not always as CLEAR as she could be. Punctual, as in, you'd better be seated and ready to talk BEFORE class starts. Smart. Haughty. The real deal.

For whatever reason a lot of people say she is hard. I am here to tell you, she is NOT hard. She is somewhat strict, but if you do the work and stay on track you will find it is actually dare I say fairly easy.
Very clear instructions. Down-to-earth, Southern style. Does not assign busywork. You will learn a lot about writing and language in this class.GREAT teacher.

Enjoyed her teaching process, especially in breaking down the major project into several smaller assignments. She will teach you how to approach a research paper. She is flexible but not a push-over. Some of the assigned readings were incomprehensible at first but classroom discussions helped. Fair amount of writing involved. Take-home mid-term.

Outstanding. Excellent teacher. I know for a fact that my writing improved from taking her class. Textbooks not needed at all. All she wants is for her students to form an opinion about topics and write passionately about them (for Argumentative Writing). I'd take her again in a heartbeat.
Excellent teacher. Very cool. Her vast experience and knowledge inform her teaching style.

She is very difficult.  She makes clear what she wants but i dont believe anyone fufills exactly what she wants.  Very hard grader and you somewhat become discouraged.  I worked very hard in this class and she does not give you the time of day to improve, once she sees youre writting style and how she personally likes you youre grade is done

I think she is a VERY good teacher. All you have to do is work your butt off and show her that your trying and go to her office for help and you will make a decent grade.  It is kind of tough to get an A but not impossible.

She's VERY difficult, but at the same time a really good professor. You'll learn a lot from her class and she gives you well enough time to revise your papers and will definetly give you help if you want/need it. I'd recommend her if you want to learn something but not if you just want an easy A.
She is very hard. She grades very harshly. She is also very intimidating. She is willing to help, but she is just a really hard grader.
Very difficult to approach as a student.  She is almost intimidating.  She is very much an ego-maniac.
